review.body: The dilithium patch looks ok to me.

pull_request.title: Jg arm dilithium
pull_request.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
This PR adds multi-upstream support for signatures to copy_from_upstream.

Arm optimized version of Dilithium2, 3, 5 have also been pulled in from pqclean. I could of things to point out:
1) pqclean's implementation of Dilithium does not support randomized signing. After a discussion with @dstebila, I have patched the arm implementation so that it only supports randomized signing. This was done instead of pushing to upstream since we are only pulling one implementation of dilithium from pqclean. Once upstream gets patched to support randomized signing, then this patch will need to be revised.

2) The `pqclean_name`s in the `copy_from_upstream.yml` file have been updated to match the formatting in pqclean's repo. This caused several of the dilithium folders to be renamed. I think that might be part of why the ci is failing currently, but I'm not sure. All tests pass on my M1 mac.


<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography
